result.execSummary:
The defendant Hardel Harrison Sherrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hardel Harrison Sherrell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hardel Harrison Sherrell was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber is allowed for work, school and child care under the Sheriff's rules. May serve in Dakota County if it's arranged and no extra cost to Pierce County. No electronic monitoring.
May apply for expungement upon successful completion of sentence: stay law abiding for 6 months and upon full payment of fine in 15CT20, given 1 year to pay.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's JOC and Judgment of Dismissal/Acquittal. Return to Sender/Not Deliverable as addressed.

9;30 Defendant Hardel Harrison Sherrell in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CT20 heard at this time. Thorie: 15CF53 guilty to Ct#2, dismiss Ct#1 and Ct#3. 15CT20 guilty to that charge. 30 days jails on each case; concurrent. does not oppose expungement if the Def stays law abiding for 6 months. Bub and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court states there is a minimum fine on 15CT20 of $611; Thorie and Bub agree.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 15CF53 and charge in 15CT20; Bub stipulates to a factual basis.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#2 in 15CF53; dismiss Ct#1 and Ct#3. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of 15CT20.  Thorie and Bub address sentencing. No restitution claim.  Bub argues for 5 days jail with huber for work and child care. Def addresses court.  Court: orders fine in the amount of $611 on 15CT20. Def will be able to apply for expungement upon full payment of the fine and stay law abiding for 6 months. 1 year to pay the fine. Court orders 16 days jail on 15CF53 stayed until June 3, 2016 at 5pm. Huber is allowed for work, school and child care under the Sheriff's rule. May serve at Dakota County if there is no extra cost to Pierce County. No electronic monitoring.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
includes 15CT20. Defendant's Notice of Hearing. Unable to Forward/For Review

3:48  15CT20 is following with this case.  Defendant Hardel Harrison Sherrell in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Information is reviewed with the defendant.   DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY to all 3 counts. Court receives the pleas  Set for PTC  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.

9:25 To include 15CT20 Defendant Hardel Harrison Sherrell in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Mitchell Rhiel is swn and exam by Atty Thorie. Deputy Rhiel id's defendant Hardel Harrison Sherrell. Exhibit 1 copy of St Croix County bail bond  dated 8/2014 O/R. Atty Bub xexams Deputy Rhiel. Ex 2 map from google maps of Prescott WI. Ex 3 map from google maps of Prescott WI. EX 3 O/R. No argument by Atty Bub.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings. Atty Bub requests to do arraignment at a later date. Thorie files information with court.   The bond will continue as ordered. Judge reviews conditions with defendant. 9:40
